refnamediv.refpurpose: Functions used during initialisation of libgnome and other platform libraries.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: LIBGNOME_MODULE
refsect2.para: This macro wraps the call to libgnome_module_info_get() and is the usual way of retrieving the GnomeModuleInfo returned by this function.

refsect2.title: libgnome_module_info_get ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the current libgnome version and the modules it depends on.

listitem.simpara: a new GnomeModuleInfo structure describing the version and the versions of the dependents.

refsect2.title: gnome_bonobo_module_info_get ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the bonobo module version and indicate that it requires the current libgnome and its dependencies (although libbonobo does not depend on libgnome, libbonoboui does and this will also be initialised when initialising a GNOME app).

listitem.simpara: a new GnomeModuleInfo structure describing the version of the bonobo modules and its dependents.

refsect2.title: gnome_user_dir_get ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the user-specific directory for GNOME apps to use ($HOME/.gnome2 is the usual GNOME 2 value).

listitem.simpara: An absolute path to the directory.

refsect2.title: gnome_user_private_dir_get ()
refsect2.para: Differs from gnome_user_dir_get() in that the directory returned here will have had permissions of 0700 (rwx------) enforced when it was created. Of course, the permissions may have been altered since creation, so care still needs to be taken.

listitem.simpara: An absolute path to the user-specific private directory that GNOME apps can use.

refsect2.title: gnome_user_accels_dir_get ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the user-specific directory that stores the keyboard shortcut files for each GNOME app. Note that most applications should be using GConf for storing this information, but it may be necessary to use the gnome_user_accels_dir_get() directory for legacy applications.

listitem.simpara: The absolute path to the directory.
